### What is linterp?
This is a C++ header-only library for N-dimensional linear interpolation on a rectangular grid, similar to Matlab's [interpn](http://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/interpn.html) command. Arbitrary dimensions are supported, but must be specified as a template parameter at compile time. Two linear interpolation algorithms can be used:
* Multilinear: Interpolate using the N-dimensional hypercube containing the point. The interpolation step is O(2^N), but more accurate.
* Simplicial: Interpolate using the N-dimensional simplex containing the point. The interpolation step is O(N log N), so this algorithm becomes much faster in higher dimensions, at the cost of decreased accuracy.
Requires the [boost.multi_array](www.boost.org/libs/multi_array) library.

For a description of the two interpolation algorithms, see:
* Weiser & Zarantonello (1988), "A Note on Piecewise Linear and Multilinear Table Interpolation in Many Dimensions", _Mathematics of Computation_ 50 (181), p. 189-196
* Davies (1996), "Multidimensional Triangulation and Interpolation for Reinforcement Learning", _Proceedings of Neural Information Processing Systems 1996_

### Python interface
